name: Name the Sport : USA Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following sports did Chauncey Billups play?
questions.explanation:
Basketball.

	Chauncey first started his career with the Denver Nuggets, then played two years with Minnesota and Detroit.  He was traded back to the Nuggets before the 2008-09 season.

questions.text: Which of the following sports did Steve Ott play?
questions.explanation:
Ice Hockey.

	Steve Ott was drafted in 2000. He spent the decade with the Dallas Stars.

questions.text: Arthur Ashe played which sport professionally?
questions.explanation:
Tennis.

	Arthur Ashe was the first African-American to win Wimbledon.

questions.text: What professional sport did Vijay Singh thrive in?
questions.explanation:
Golf.

	Singh had more than 50 professional wins, and won more than 30 PGA Tournaments.

questions.text: Which sport was found to host the 2009 Masters?
questions.explanation:
Golf.

	In the 2009 Masters, there was a three-way playoff between Angel Cabrera, Kenny Perry, and Chad Campbell.  Cabrera was eventually victorious.

questions.text: Which of the following sports found Olympic medalist Michael Johnson competing?
questions.explanation:
Track and Field.

	Michael Johnson won four Olympic gold medals, and set a world record for the 400m.

questions.text: Which of the following sports did Norm Duke make his money from?
questions.explanation:
Bowling.

	Norm Duke won more than 30 Pro Bowling Association titles in his career.

questions.text: Which of the following sports did Kyle Korver compete in professionally?
questions.explanation:
Basketball.

	Korver was a rookie with the Philadelphia 76ers in the 2003-04 season.  In 2009, he was a member of the Utah Jazz.

questions.text: In 2008, Kosuke Fukudome was competing in which professional sport?
questions.explanation:
Baseball.

	Kosuke Fukudome was a rookie outfielder with the Chicago Cubs in 2008.

questions.text: Cobi Jones was known for playing which sport?
questions.explanation:
Soccer.

	Jones was a player, and later coached the Los Angeles Galaxy of the MLS.  He also was the career leader in caps for the United States National Team.
